Thank you for your patience and understanding as we navigate a moving target.

We ask that you review the documents and send us your choice by Monday, August 3rd at 12:00 pm.

Have a wonderful day!
Lisa Harrod

Manteno Middle School
July 24 at 6:30 PM ·

Manteno Middle School families:

It is with much disappointment that we inform you that today we received an email from the IESA notifying member schools that they are cancelling the regular season and IESA state series in the sports of boys and girls golf, boys baseball, girls softball, and boys and girls cross-country for the 2020-21 school year. There are no plans to try and re-schedule the activities or conduct them later in the school year. The safety of student athletes, coaches, officials and fans was the primary factor in the decisions made by the IESA board.

We are excited that winter and spring sports are still scheduled to be played. We can’t wait to see our athletes put the Manteno Panther uniform on and step back into their respective sports.

Thank you for flexibility, understanding and support as we navigate uncharted waters in sports. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact Josh Carlile at jcarlile@manteno5.org or call the Middle School office at 815-928-7150.

Very Respectfully,

Josh Carlile,
Manteno MS Athletic Director
815-928-7181
jcarlile@manteno5.org

As a result, the first day for students will now be Wednesday, August 19th.

Manteno Middle School students participated in Northwestern's Accelerated Weekend Experience (AWE) at Manteno High School!

5th & 6th graders that earned an Exceeds on IAR testing or were in the top 95% on the FASTBridge winter benchmark were invited to attend the Northwestern AWE through a partnership created in 2014. Students participated in a course titled “Outbreak: Immunology & Infectious Diseases”. Young epidemiologists investigated different infectious diseases, the history of deadly outbreaks across the globe, and the diseases scientists are fighting today.

7th & 8th graders that earned an Exceeds on IAR testing were also invited to attend the event Students participated in a course titled “Comparative Anatomy”. They addressed questions about the evolution of animal life by comparing a variety of animals of different species and taxonomic groups.
